intro: Stisseria mammillaris, commonly known as the mammillary stisseria, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine pubescence. Stisseria mammillaris is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
